other_tests.findings: Induration (8 mm in diameter) developed at the site of the test.
Nonobstructive fungating mass (4 cm by 2 cm) at the ileocecal valve; biopsy showed severely active chronic colitis with fibrinopurulent exudate.

Repeated colonoscopy and upper endoscopy showed ileocecal mass, small inflammatory nodules in the lower two thirds of the esophagus, an oozing cratered ulcer in the gastric body, and diffuse moderately erythematous mucosa in the duodenal bulb; biopsy revealed erosive gastritis, chronic ileitis, and ileocolitis with ulceration and non-necrotizing granulomas.
Examination of freshly obtained biopsy specimens revealed ulcerated mucosa with granulation tissue and necrosis with numerous acid-fast bacilli.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Confirmed diagnosis of mycobacterial ileitis/m. tuberculosis.

other_tests.procedure_name: CT of the Abdomen and Pelvis
other_tests.findings: Persistently thickened circumferential wall of the terminal ileum and cecum with adjacent fat stranding.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Increased slightly since previous imaging studies.
